actor2: MLCJ: Movement of Central African Liberators for Justice
assoc_actor_2: Goula Ethnic Group (Central African Republic)
notes: On 9 August 2020, FPRC militia combatants (Rounga ethnicity) clashed with MLCJ forces (Goula ethnicity) in Bria (Bria, Haute-Kotto). No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

actor1: Government of the Central African Republic (2016-)
actor2: UPC: Union for Peace in the Central African Republic
assoc_actor_2: Former Seleka Militia
notes: On 6 August 2020, the Central African Republic Prime Minister signed an agreement in Bangui (Banui, Bangui) with the leader of the UPC (Union for Peace in the Central African Republic) armed group, Ali Darass. The latter committed not to hinder the return of state authority as well as the free movement of agents of the ANE (National Election Authority) before the upcoming election. In exchange, among other agreements, this armed group was allowed to return to Bambari (Ouaka), their former headquarters.

actor1: UN: United Nations
actor2: RRR: Return, Reclamation and Rehabilitation
notes: On 5 August 2020, the UN Security Council voted to impose sanctions on Sidiki Abbas, the leader of the 3R armed group (Return, Reclamation and Rehabilitation). The group, who withdrew from a peace agreement in June 2020, was accused of killing, torturing, raping and displacing civilians as well as engaging in arms trafficking and in war with other militias since its creation in 2015.

actor1: Anti-Balaka
actor2: Military Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-)
notes: On 2 August 2020, Anti-Balaka armed men led by the self-appointed general Mandayo clashed with FOCA military forces in Grimari (Grimari, Ouaka) following an incursion by these rebels. The Anti-Balaka men, who had intercepted a vehicle with electoral staff and looted some shops, were finally driven off by the military forces. Several militia combatants were killed including the leader Mandayo, and several others were injured. Unknown fatalities coded as 3.

actor1: Military Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-)
actor2: Police Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-)
notes: On 31 July 2020, FOCA soldiers clashed with policemen in Bangui-6 (Bangui) following a personal dispute. The exchange of fire resulted in 6 people shot and injured, including 1 civilian.

actor2: Anti-Balaka

notes: On 26 July 2020, MINUSCA and national military troops clashed with the 3R armed group in Besson (Baboua, Nana-Mambere) in the context of a military operation against the expansion of this rebel group. The state forces drove the militia combatants out and took full control of the town. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

actor1: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
actor2: RRR: Return, Reclamation and Rehabilitation

The latter drove the rebels out this town, an important center of cattle production. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

notes: On 21 July 2020, FOCA soldiers (Military Forces) arbitrarily arrested, tortured and jailed 2 men in Paoua (Ouham Pende) following a personal dispute between the military and these men in a night bar the previous week.

A MINUSCA soldier was injured, and members of the 3R were killed. According to rumours, the leader of the group was killed, but such was denied by the group. Fatalities coded as 3 and split across two events.

The ambush resulted in 5 soldiers killed, including a gendarme, and 10 injured. Six other soldiers went missing. The incident took place during the course of military operations against this militia.

actor1: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa
actor2: Government of the Central African Republic (2016-)
notes: On 22 June 2020, the FPRC started the disarmament and demobilization process in Ndele (Bamingui-Bangoran), where more than 80 combatants handed over 41 weapons, including mortars, machine guns and anti-tank weapons. The process was part of a peace and demobilization agreement signed with the government authorities in 2018.

No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

The rebels left 2 peacekeepers with minor injuries and 4 others disarmed before leaving.

notes: On 9 June 2020, a group of 3R armed men carrying heavy weapons clashed with military soldiers of the Special Mixed Security Units (USMS) during an assault of these rebels against a USMS training military base in Wantiguira village, 8 Km from Bouar (Bouar, Nana-Mambere). The rebels seized weapons and ammunitions. FACA and MINUSCA reinforcements arrived and managed to drive back the rebels, killing at least 5 and recovering part of the weaponry stolen. At least 17 soldiers were injured and 2 rebels were arrested.

actor1: MPC: Patriotic Movement for Central African Republic

The MINUSCA managed to arrest some of the militiamen, including one of the leaders. No fatalities and/or injuries reported.

actor1: Police Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-)
actor2: Janjaweed
notes: On 8 June 2020, the Sudanese former leader of the Janjaweed militia in Darfur, Ali Kushayb, was arrested by Central African Republic authorities in Birao (Birao, Vakaga), close to the border with Sudan. Kushayb, who is charged with 50 crimes against humanity and war crimes by the International Criminal Court (ICC), voluntarily handed himself over 13 years after an international warrant was issued for him. He was then transferred to an ICC's detention center in The Hague (The Netherlands).

notes: 26 October. The National Assembly removed Karim Mechassoua, the President of the Assembly. Mechassoua, a Muslim, was seen as a balancing force against the Christian presidency. His dismissal is viewed by some as an attempt by President Touadera to concentrate his control. The following day, the CNDS (a coalition of ex-Seleka groups) urged all groups associated with the government to vacate the areas under their control within 48 hours, although a separate statement issued by FPRC denied this ultimatum.

actor1: MNLC: National Movement for the Liberation of the Central African Republic
actor2: Military Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-)
notes: 26 October. Suspected MNLC members attacked three FACA soldiers, who were being deployed to Bembere. The attackers abducted one of the soldiers. The soldier later escaped on 28/10.

actor1: CNDS: Coalition for National Defense and Security
actor2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)
notes: 26 October. Gunmen fired at a MINUSCA check-point along the Bambari-Alindo road. The gunmen are suspected to be linked to members of the CNDS coalition as the attack followed the dismissal of Karim Mechassoua from the National Assembly.

actor1: FPRC: Popular Front for the Renaissance of Central Africa (Adam Faction)

actor1: MNLC: National Movement for the Liberation of the Central African Republic
actor2: MINUSCA: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in the Central African Republic (2014-)

actor1: Military Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-) Special Forces Battalion

Some have speculated that the autonomy of the new division is a means of circumventing the FACA-MINUSCA mission.

actor1: MNLC: National Movement for the Liberation of the Central African Republic

At least three people were killed (the UN indicates six fatalities, three of which were civilians) and two were wounded. Security forces have increased their patrol of the area.

actor1: Military Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-)

Over 400 protesters gathered outside of the MINUSCA base in Bria carrying the bodies of people killed in the Bria area the day before, to express frustration over the force's failure to protect civilians from the recent attacks by FPRC and Anti-Balaka. MINUSCA reported two grenades being thrown at the base by the protesters, while locals alleged MINUSCA fired tear gas at them.

During the intermittent clashes, 18 civilians were killed in total, 1500-2000 houses burned down, and 7000 people forced to flee.
